alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 11:25AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY ALONG KENAI RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...Kenai River near below Skilak Lake, including Kenai Keys. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1120 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels on the Kenai River from the Snow Glacier-dammed lake outburst occurring near Snow River. Steady river rises will cause minor flooding along Kenai River. - - Water levels along the Kenai River will continue to increase through this weekend before decreasing late Monday morning. High water levels are expected further downstream in the lower Kenai River, but flooding is not expected. - - Some locations that will experience flooding include... - For Kenai River below Skilak Lake: At 10:30am the stage was 12.36 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 13.0 feet is expected around 4:00am Monday. - For Kenai River at Kenai Keys: At 8:00am the stage was 10.41 feet. Flood Stage is 11.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 11.1 feet is expected around 10:00pm Sunday. Impacts: At 10.7 feet: In October of 2020, water was in the lowest lying garages of the Kenai Keys subdivision. At 12.0 feet: Water starts to flow over some of the roads in the Kenai Keys subdivision. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
